articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets French Presidential Envoy
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets French Presidential Envoy
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Jack Lang, special envoy of the French President, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Trade Union Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Trade Union Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the delegation of the All-China Federation of Trade Union led by Vice-Chairwoman Qiao Chuanxiu at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					The head of the delegation said that they would value the traditional China-DPRK friendship provided by leaders of the elder generation of the two countries and make contribution to consolidating and developing it.

articles.title: Credentials of U.N. Resident Coordinator Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of U.N. Resident Coordinator Accepted
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Thursday received credentials from Jerome Sauvage, U.N. resident coordinator and resident representative of the UNDP to the DPRK.
					 The foreign minister had a talk with the guest after receiving his credentials.

articles.title: DPRK, Mexican Public Health Min. Sign Agreement
articles.content:
DPRK, Mexican Public Health Min. Sign Agreement
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in the field of public health and traditional medicine was signed between the Ministry of Public Health of the DPRK and the Ministry of Health of the United Mexican States in Mexico City on Nov. 4.
					 The agreement was signed by So Jae Myong, DPRK ambassador to Mexico, and Jose Angel Cordova Villalobos, secretary of Health of Mexico, respectively.

articles.title: Anniversary of Libyan Revolution Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Libyan Revolution Observed
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- Abdelhafiz Misbah Bin Rabha, chief of the Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya to the DPRK, Wednesday arranged a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the Great September First Revolution in Libya.
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: New Books Published
articles.content:
New Books Published
Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The Kumsong Youth Publishing House of the DPRK has brought out new books.
					The book "Old Story of Songdo" carries tales handed down in the areas around Kaesong, the capital of the first unified state Koryo in Korea during the periods of Koryo (918-1392) and Ri Dynasty (1392-1910). Kaesong was once called Kaegyong, Songdo, Hwangsong and other names. The book also gives data of historical mementoes and common knowledge.
					
					Among the new books are a full-length novel "Star of Friendship", a collection of Korean folk tales vol. 2 "Khongjwi and Phatjwi" and a collection of humorous anecdotage "Speaking 'Dummy'".

articles.title: Secondary School, Producer of Promising Footballers
articles.content:
Secondary School, Producer of Promising Footballers
Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- There are many schools training promising athletes in DPRK. 
					Among them is Pyongyang May 13 Ryongnam Secondary School. It has been well known to the whole country for its produce of many able male footballers.
					
					The school has distinguished itself in over 10 national or Pyongyang City male football contests of secondary school students, including the National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize.
					
					Graduates of the school, Choe Myong Ho, Kim Yong Jun, An Il Bom and Kim Chol Ho of the DPRK team made their bit in the 2006 AFC Under-19 Soccer Championship, the Asian final preliminary for FIFA 2010 World Cup and other international soccer games.
					
					Besides, many graduates who polished football techniques at the school are active at leading local sports teams as forwards with exquisite scoring tricks and reliable half backs.
					
					Mun Kwang Sop, with a career of 20-odd-year physical culture teacher, said that he would extensively operate after-school sports circle and thus rear more reserves of athletes who would glorify the honor of the country with gold medals.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on U.S. Failure in Its "Anti-Terror War"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on U.S. Failure in Its "Anti-Terror War"
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces have fought the reckless "anti-terror war," utterly disregarding the capability and will of the people aspiring after independence and having no elementary consideration of their ability, too much obsessed with the idea of "military technological superiority." Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a signed article.
					 It goes on: No doubt this is a hopeless war for the U.S. It has failed to put under its control the struggle of the anti-U.S. resistance forces in Afghanistan and Iraq, adding to the toll of its troops, as it was not aware of its big ideological, moral and military weak points, contending that it could win the "anti-terror war" if it only goes superior in weaponry and military technology.
					
					 The U.S. forces ignited the Afghan and Iraqi wars all of a sudden, pinning much hope on their latest type weapons. These weapons, however, failed to play a decisive role.
					
					 The U.S. forces are serving in the army to have their individual selfish desires realized. This is one of their ideological and moral weak points. 
					
					 They are operating hundreds of military bases in many countries and regions, having too many military targets and too long a front. This is also one of their vulnerable points. 
					
					 They also failed to calculate that where independence is infringed upon, there always comes resistance and where there is resistance there always comes a revolutionary struggle. 
					
					 The U.S. forces are now pushing the "anti-terror war" to a catastrophe, their energy waning, the article says, adding that the failure in the "anti-terror war" means a failure in their strategy based on strength.
					
					 The worldwide fierce anti-U.S. movement against the "anti-terror war" is bringing the U.S. position of being the world's "only superpower" to a rapid decline and precipitating the process of global independence, concludes the article.

articles.title: S. Korea Will Be Forced to Pay Dearly for Armed Provocation
articles.content:
S. Korea Will Be Forced to Pay Dearly for Armed Provocation
Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean forces will be forced to pay dearly for the grave armed provocation perpetrated by them in the waters of the north side in the West Sea of Korea on November 10. This warning is served by papers Thursday in signed commentaries. 
					Rodong Sinmun observes: The south Korean military authorities are now making much fuss in a bid to mislead the public opinion, describing the proper measure for self-defence taken by the north against a group of warships of the south Korean forces as "the third skirmish in the West Sea." This is like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					The latest armed clash in the West Sea was not a simple accidental incident but a deliberate and premeditated provocation perpetrated by the south Korean military in an effort to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula, the daily notes, and goes on:
					
					It is a trite method of the south Korean warmongers to perpetrate a shocking provocation to derail any process for improving the north-south relations.
					
					Nobody can deny the fact that the armed provocation perpetrated by them again in the West Sea is nothing but a deliberate and vicious move for increasing the tension and a dangerous war action of those much upset by the trend of the situation on the peninsula. This is a clear indictment meted out to the south Korean warmongers hell bent on the treacherous acts to disturb the peace on the peninsula and do harm to fellow countrymen by force of arms in collusion with outside forces while hamstringing the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					The artillery pieces of the KPA convinced of justice and afire with hatred are now leveled at the provokers. 
					
					The south Korean military had better face up to the trend of the times and behave itself.
					
					Minju Joson urges the south Korean military authorities to stop digging their own graves, make an apology to the nation for the armed provocation and take a responsible measure against the recurrence of the similar case.

articles.title: Trinidad President Wishes for Korean Reunification
articles.content:
Trinidad President Wishes for Korean Reunification
 Pyongyang, November 12 (KCNA) -- I came to know well about the great successes made by the people of the DPRK in the economic construction in recent years under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					George Maxwell Richard, President of Trinidad and Tobago, said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to his country on Nov. 5.
					
					He noted he came to get a clear understanding of the policy of the DPRK government for the reunification of Korea and its strenuous efforts to achieve it and its stand on the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					He appreciated the sincere efforts made by the DPRK government for the reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and hoped that the reunification of Korea would be achieved independently and peacefully in line with the declarations adopted by the north and the south of Korea.
					
					The government of Trinidad and Tobago expresses the hope for boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in various domains including politics, economy and culture, he added.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Jack Lang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Jack Lang
Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 12 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el enviado especial del presidente de la Republica de Francia, Jack Lang, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun recibe cartas credenciales de funcionario de ONU
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun recibe cartas credenciales de funcionario de ONU
Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun recibio el dia 12 las cartas credenciales de Jerome Sauvage, coordinador permanente de la ONU y representante permanente del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo en Corea.
					Luego, el canciller departio con su huesped.

articles.title: Rubricado convenio Corea-Mexico sobre cooperacion en salud publica
articles.content:
Rubricado convenio Corea-Mexico sobre cooperacion en salud publica
Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 4 en la Ciudad de Mexico el convenio sobre la cooperacion en la salud publica y la medicina tradicional entre los Ministerios de Salud Publica de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos.
					Lo firmaron el embajador coreano en Mexico So Jae Myong y el secretario de Salud Publica mexicano, Jose Angel Cordova Villalobos.

articles.title: Periodicos capitalinos increpan provocacion militar en Mar Oeste
articles.content:
Periodicos capitalinos increpan provocacion militar en Mar Oeste
Pyongyang, 12 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Los periodicos capitalinos publicaron en sus ediciones de hoy los comentarios individuales advirtiendo que el ejercito surcoreano pagara muy caro la grave provocacion armada cometida el pasado dia 10 en las aguas jurisdiccionales de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el Mar Oeste.
					El diario Rodong Sinmun revela que ahora, el circulo militar del Sur de Corea arma escandalos criticando nuestra debida medida de autodefensa  tomada contra la flotilla surcoreana, que cometio la provocacion, como "tercer conflicto armado en el Mar Oeste".
					
					Tal embuste, que esta enganando a la opinion publica, parte de la cinica logica de bandido presto a golpear a la victima de robo, denuncia el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					El reciente choque armado en el Mar Oeste no es una simple contingencia sino la provocacion premeditada de la capa militar del Sur de Corea empenada en agravar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Es un metodo rutinario de los belicistas surcoreanos incurrir en una drastica accion provocativa para frenar el desarrollo positivo de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas cada vez que se daban las senales de ello. 
					
					Es innegable que ese incidente es una maniobra intencional, siniestra y peligrosa de los tipejos, que estan ansiosos por exacerbar la tension y desatar la guerra aturdidos ante la corriente de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El incidente constituye, ademas, otra muestra evidente de los crimenes antinacionales de los belicistas surcoreanos que perturban la paz de la Peninsula Coreana obstaculizando la mejora de las relaciones N-S y actuan desesperadamente para atacar a los connacionales con las fuerzas armadas en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Ahora nuestra artilleria, dispuesta a imponer la justicia y cargada de odio, esta apuntando a los provocadores.
					
					La capa militar surcoreana debe actuar con prudencia al ver correctamente la corriente de la epoca actual.
					
					El periodico Minju Joson insiste en que las autoridades militares surcoreanas deben pedir disculpas ante la nacion por su provocacion armada en lugar de cometer esta accion suicida y les demanda tomar medidas responsables para evitar la repeticion de ella.
